private_information: I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D
A is the smallest disk and J is the largest
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal configuration is achieved while only moving disks A, B, C, D and respecting Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I am allowed to move disks E, F, G
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal configuration is achieved while only moving disks E, F, G and respecting Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I am allowed to move disks H, I, J
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal configuration is achieved while only moving disks H, I, J and respecting Tower of Hanoi rules

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move sequences and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that encodes the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance with distinct agent actions and achieves the global goal configuration

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top to bottom A, B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top to bottom C; right peg empty.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, only the top disk of any peg can be moved, and a disk may not be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Each agent is restricted to move only a subset of disks: agent_1 can move A, B, C, D; agent_2 can move E, F, G; agent_3 can move H, I, J.
Agents must provide primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from pegP to pegQ', where pegP and pegQ are one of left, middle, right.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and you can move only disks A, B, C, D. Given the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance and your private knowledge about which disks you may move, provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must follow the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move only top disks, and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Do not attempt to move disks you are not allowed to move. Focus on your portion of the cooperative plan to reach the global goal.
moves.prompt: Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide the ordered moves you will execute as atomic primitive moves in the specified format.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and you can move only disks E, F, G. Given the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance and your private knowledge about which disks you may move, provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must follow the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move only top disks, and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Do not attempt to move disks you are not allowed to move. Focus on your portion of the cooperative plan to reach the global goal.
moves.prompt: Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide the ordered moves you will execute as atomic primitive moves in the specified format.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and you can move only disks H, I, J. Given the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance and your private knowledge about which disks you may move, provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must follow the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move only top disks, and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Do not attempt to move disks you are not allowed to move. Focus on your portion of the cooperative plan to reach the global goal.
moves.prompt: Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Provide the ordered moves you will execute as atomic primitive moves in the specified format.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL and must produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the move sequences provided by the agents and encode a domain that represents the Tower of Hanoi rules and distinct agent actions. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing or otherwise distinguishing actions for agent_1, agent_2, and agent_3. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain and problem correctly represent the initial configuration and the goal configuration specified in the public information and are compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the ordered primitive moves from each agent. The moves may be partial or overlapping. Use the moves to construct a coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that achieve the global goal. Inputs: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3}. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards, preserving distinct agent action names and ensuring consistency with Tower of Hanoi rules. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
